alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Harrison; Ritchie; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 12:52PM EDT until August 07 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Ritchie County in northwestern West Virginia... Doddridge County in northern West Virginia... Southeastern Tyler County in northern West Virginia... Northern Harrison County in northern West Virginia... * Until 130 PM EDT. * At 1252 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near West Union, or 16 miles southeast of Middlebourne, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Shinnston, Salem, Lumberport, West Union, Enterprise, Alma, Greenwood, Blandville, Avon, Wolf Summit, New Milton, Wallace, Smithburg, Lima, Center Point, Sedalia, Canton, and Meadowbrook. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 44 and 75. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northern and northwestern West Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northern and northwestern West Virginia.
